name: places/ChIJ88p6YJVYwokRxVrMo82uG8s
formattedAddress: 155 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 155 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021-2810, USA

originalText.text: I've been going to this doctor for years. He's a detail doctor that listens to all your concerns. I never had an issue with him personally. He does have a very small doctor office. The wait time is horrible. The office manager is rude and bossy. She has no people skills. You can hear her talk to the staff like they are nothing.  Otherwise the staff is pretty friendly and respectable. If the office manager would stay in her little room things would be perfect during your visit.

text.text: I've been going to this doctor for years. He's a detail doctor that listens to all your concerns. I never had an issue with him personally. He does have a very small doctor office. The wait time is horrible. The office manager is rude and bossy. She has no people skills. You can hear her talk to the staff like they are nothing.  Otherwise the staff is pretty friendly and respectable. If the office manager would stay in her little room things would be perfect during your visit.

originalText.text: Most judgmental disrespectful  doctor I have ever encountered. I work in a hospital and have vast experience with medical professions. This man  is truly the worst of the worst. He has a whole gang of people in the examination room. I understand one extra person but why do you need an entourage? He’s rude; he states unrealistic diagnosis and when questioned what his diagnosis are based on he can’t give you clear symptoms of why he believes these diagnosis to be true. He states he is going to rule it out. Yet can’t tell you what’s making him rule it in. Horrendous experience. Don’t waste your time going there. He should be kind and retire no one should ever have to experience what I just went through.

originalText.text: Dr. Purohit is very attentive, warm, and caring. When dealing with patients there is never a sense of urgency, taking his time with each patient to the tee. You'll find that he's quite compassionate in his communication style which makes one feel comfortable and important. Certainly a go-to endocrinologist.

originalText.text: I visited Dr. Amar yesterday.  In my view, he is a caring doctor and willing to listen.  I would not say listening is his first instinct, but he is willing to listen.  Many doctors dont listen @ all, and are not honest and upfront about what they do/don't know.  So far, I have been pleased with my experience.  Should that change, I will update you.

originalText.text: I waited for 3 hours in this crowded office, to find out the doctor had paused for dinner. When I finally did see him he looked at my bloodwork and told me everything was normal. I told him I had many symptoms and was feeling terrible and he said there was nothing wrong. Subsequently I was diagnosed with the autoimmune disease he told me I did not have. One of the worst drs I have ever seen in my life.
